class_notes: Prerequisite: ENVS 131 OR permission of the instructor. For ENVS majors, this course will fulfill the Intermediate Breadth requirement in Ecology/Environmental Health. Introduces students to the biology of infectious diseases, disease ecology, conservation and management related issues affecting wildlife.
course_description: A course designed for second year students on topics of interest in environmental sciences. This course may count as elective credit for the ENVS major and minor; relevant topics may count towards the ENVS Sustainability Sciences or Earth and Atmospheric Sciences minors. See current course atlas.
schedule_location: TTh 1pm-2:15pm in Math & Science Center - W502
